intro: Talauma stellata, commonly known as the star-shaped talauma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that resemble stars, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Talauma stellata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
